website_summaries.verdict: This sensory sand is softer and finer than other competing brands. It's more prone to color bleeding, though, so select a lighter hue.
pros: Sticks to itself, not to you
Stays wet and doesn't dry out
Comes with six molds, including castle and pyramid
cons: Sand may stick to other things besides itself

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I had something similar that I bought at a chain crafts store and don't recall having the problems I've had with this sand. I find this sand sticks to my children's clothes and hands and is impossible to get off rugs. It almost seems to stain both skin and fabric. Not sure if it has to do with the bright color or the quality of the product. Either way, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KNR

customer_reviews.title: ... to our kinetic sand stash and I am so sad that I mixed it with our other sand as ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this sand to add to our kinetic sand stash and I am so sad that I mixed it with our other sand as it is very poor quality. It is much less sticky than our other sand which means it instantly got all over clothing and the floor. The pigment came off on my child's hands and clothing.
customer_reviews.author: kira baum

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Had to put a little water just to ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Had to put a little water just to try and moisten it after leaving out for more than an hr like the directions said. Stained our hands and a complete mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M. Boz

customer_reviews.title: More like Play-Doh
customer_reviews.text: Worst kinetic sand ever. It’s more like play doh.... that’s almost dried out. If choosing between Nat Geo sand and the Kinetic Sand Brand, choose the Kinetic. In the picture attached the darker purple sand is Kinetic Sand and on the left is the Nat Geo “Sand”
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves it, but it makes a huge mess. I thought the sand would stay together better. Fine pink dusk everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: kolter kesler

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very hard and dry feeling when you first open the bag but do not add water. Yes, it will feel like a dry brick. Fluff it up with your hand and let it sit and it does get soft and fluffy just like the images. Did not stain hands or anything else unless you use wet hands or get the sand wet. We squeezed it and smashed it into cookie cutter molds and never had any stains and it made the most gorgeous molded pieces (see photos).
customer_reviews.author: jaime

customer_reviews.title: The other colors are all fine and the kids have has a great time
customer_reviews.text: I bought all 3 colors for a Easter gift and the green one is completely dry. The other colors are all fine and the kids have has a great time.
customer_reviews.author: TG24

customer_reviews.title: Buyr, be aware
customer_reviews.text: It does not feel like sand. It is more like play dough. I think the name of the product is misleading. If you are looking for kinetic sand, this product is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: losist

customer_reviews.title: Good sand
customer_reviews.text: I decided to make my boys an indoor sand box because with the pandemic going on I wanted them to have an outdoor activity indoors. First I bought the kinetic sand, it has larger granules (the traditional sand shade) however the kinetic sand in the colors has a more finely grained mica texture. The National Geographic sand is like that the fine texture like mica. It did mix well with the kinetic brand sand and my boys love it. However the sand was in cheap bags that were not as airtight as kinetic brand.
customer_reviews.author: Heidileejade

customer_reviews.title: difficult to get sand picked up once played with
customer_reviews.text: I like this little set, its cute for my 3 year old daughter, and its a great price but the sand is not like Kinetic sand in the way you can use the sand to pick up smaller pieces by dabbing little piles with a bigger glob of sand. It doesnt stick so you need to use a dust pan and broom to gather the sand to put away which adds debris. Its much lighter density, but its fun for how ever long it will last before she has thrown it around so much it is all vacuumed up.
customer_reviews.author: shaylynn

customer_reviews.title: Great sand for outdoor sandbox
customer_reviews.text: I love that sand, its so delicate, velvety feel. It reminds me about white sand beaches in Rivera Maya that are the distant dream at this time during pandemic... I purchased that sand for outdoor sandbox and I'm very happy with it. My girls (1 and 3 years old) love it. The sand molds to perfect shapes but is more dry than other kinetic sands. It feels more like wet beach sand. It also stick a bit to cloths and hands but in my opinion it's easy to clean. Perfect option for outdoor sandbox. I would recommend it for outdoor rather than indoor use. For use at home I purchased kinetic sand from diffrent producer that sticks more together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty to play with
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of sand in this box! I got the multi color box. My son says he likes it better than kinetic sand... It stays together better and feels better in hand. My daughter loves the smell but my son not so much so to each their own. Each pack comes in a plastic bag with no way to reseal. We put the open packs in old tupperware and freezer bags. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: All#4

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Stains hands and toys, rough sand.
customer_reviews.text: Comes out of the box incredibly rough. Not at all like kinetic. Says it needs an hour "rest" to soften. After an entire night, still was hard. Added a few drops water and really worked with it like the directions said, it is still not as soft as kinetic. The color is not steadfast. Bleeds on hands, tools, clothes, carpet, plastic, etc. We got the purple and my children are now scared to play with it because it stains their hands and characters they like to use in the sand bin. Should have returned when I saw how hard the bricks were and just bought the kinetic brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: The entire family loves playing with it
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this sand. We’ve had only one of the bags open for about six months now and it gets played with ALL THE TIME. After being played with by the whole entire family (even the grandparents can’t stop playing with it) for months, it still feels brand new. I’ve cleaned up what seems like a lot off the floor and it does pick in and hide in the little spaces of the toys you use as you play with it (cars, plastic animals, etc) but it cleans up nicely and we still haven’t had to open a second bag. It’s been worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Nisha

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: We gave this stuff to one of our great grandchildren for his birthday. A few days later their father texted us to let us know that all three of his very active children had spent over four hours playing with the sand. For anything to hold their attention for that length of time and to keep them playing together without fighting at the same time is amazing. I think we'll be getting more of this sand for our grandchildren who are about the same age.
customer_reviews.author: David Hutton

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS... Dye and powder problem
customer_reviews.text: I actually wrote a very positive review for this sand, but that was before my grandchildren played with it and that definitely changed my mind... I am a teacher and I use Kinetic sand all the time in my classroom. I bought this sand because it was less expensive that the sand I have in my classroom and National Geographic is a reputable company. The blue dye got all over my grandchildren's hands and everything they touched... AND the blue dust was everywhere. There are other Kinetic sand products and I definitely suggest you choose another product!!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS GOOD AS THE KINETIC SAND
customer_reviews.text: ORDERED THIS BECAUSE IT CAME IN LARGER SIZE; HOWEVER, IT IS NOT NEARLY AS GOOD AS THE "KINETIC SAND THE ORIGINAL". IT DOESN'T STAY LIGHT AND FLUFFY AND GOT TOO COMPACTED. MADE IT HARD TO DIG AND MOVE AROUND. I ENDED UP BUYING 2 BAGS OF THE REAL KINETIC SAND AND MIXED IT IN WITH THIS TO LIGHTEN IT UP A BIT. THAT HELPED A LOT. ONE THING I CAN SAY...GRANDCHILD COMES OVER AND HEADS DIRECTLY FOR SAND TABLE AND STAYS THERE FOR HOURS. NEVER HAD AN ACTIVITY HOLD HIS ATTENTION THIS WELL.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Jax

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sand to use as a choice station in my classroom. The sand is soft and works as described. I found the black tub that comes with the sand for playing and storage is rather small. I use another larger tub I have on hand to keep the sand in. We don't cover the sand each night as it just stays in its tub. The sand has not dried out and continues to stick to itself and not the students or the carpet. If it does fall out of the tub it can be picked up easily if in clumps or vacuumed up for smaller grains.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaH

customer_reviews.title: KINETIC SAND AT ITS FINEST
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I’ve read the reviews and despite of them I ordered two sets for my boys. First impression, oh man it’s like the bad reviews. So wrong. The sand comes kinda compacted which is normal, play with it and it does exactly what kinetic sand does. It’s mesmerizing. I enjoyed it and so did my boys. Just a tip, don’t get it wet and moist hands are not a good mix. That’s why a lot of reviews talk about coloring on the hands. Wrong. It’s not like play doh. IT IS KINETIC SAND. Rest assured this is a good buy. Thumbs up. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: We got this because it was green-and it was a huge mistake. There is fine sand everywhere now-my counter, the floor, and in the sinks when my kids wash their hands -oh yeah it stains their hands bright green too. This is nothing like the kinetic sand we've always played with-and kept for months. We've only had this new stuff a few days am I'm ready to throw it away! Everything grinds on my kitchen counter-it's driving me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: mother of 4

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews carefully before purchasing. Was a little hesitant as others stated the sand would stain. I have the blue color and have not had any issues at all. I've left it in a hot car several times and it has not effected the quality at all either. Great product and price, especially since it includes 6 molds. Considering buying some other colors as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tina C.

customer_reviews.title: What a mess!!!
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what was different about the Nat Geo sand. I liked it at first because it was sooooo silky and soft and the color was so vibrant, but I quickly realized that the sand sticks to EVERYTHING it touches! Especially skin! We had to give our kids baths to get it off of their hands, arms, faces, and everything else that they touched after playing with the sand. I can't endorse this product. It weny straight into the garbage after we realized we couldn't clean fast enough to counteract the mess spreading to everything.
customer_reviews.author: HungrySumo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, not at all what kinetic sand should ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, not at all what kinetic sand should be like. This stuff is dry and not the texture that kinetic sand should be. You have to add water each time you use it, because it dries out to the texture of regular sand. Even when you add water it does not have the consistency it should have. We have some of Brookstone's kinetic sand and it is awesome! It stays together, and doesn't stick to hands or anything, and is never dry and needs water. Do not buy this product if you want kinetic sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat kinetic sand provides hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC Play Sand - 2 LBS of Sand with Castle Molds and Tray (Purple) - kid loves playing with the kinetic sand and molds since it doesn't react like "normal" sand! Comes in a black plastic tray but no cover after unpacking. You have to shove the molds into the sand to make it flat enough to slip the try back into the box. Just make sure the box doesn't get turned upside down after putting the tray of sand in it though! 2 lbs of sand is perfect, price excellent and molds are cute and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining for 3 year olds
customer_reviews.text: The kinetic sand was very entertaining for the preschoolers in my class. They liked the color and the feel and shape of it. These are very busy, active children, so it was great to see them play and focus attention on an activity. Sensory activities are important for this age, so I would recommend the sand for any preschool teachers out there reading this. However, the one downfall is that.. it gets everywhere. You would think it would be easier to manage than regular sand or than paint, or mud, but it seems to show up in every crevice of our room. Have fun and get messy, but be cautioned that it does get everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: A teacher and Mom

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAND!
customer_reviews.text: This is not sand! This is exactly what its called morphing matter! I made the mistake and thought it was sand! It definitely morphs but doesn't stop morphing so its impossible to build anything because it just keeps morphing, and does take any shape whatsoever! Good sensory gift but thats it! Now the national geographic has ultimate play sand and that's great ,I give that a 5 stars! But they won't let me review it separately because they are trying to trick people into thinking morphing matter is the same as sand! And it is not!
customer_reviews.author: Rayrayzwfy0303

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A MESS🥶!!!
customer_reviews.text: This sand is everywhere! It made such a mess! We added water like the instructions said. Now I have blue sand everywhere. I had to soak my grandson in the bath tub to revive the blue dye from his hands and body!🥶😱 What a complete waste!! DO NOT BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: JANIN

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: My kids have a lot of fun with it. And although is better than real sand this "play sand" still makes a mess. The more they play with it, the less of it they have because they lose little pieces on the floor or table and although I try to pick it all up is just hard to get every single "spill" so after picking what I can, I sweep it from the floor because it collects dust and dirt and it won't be nice to save the dirty sand. I will let them enjoy the rest of it. But I would not buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Sol

customer_reviews.title: Scratches wood — so disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter played with this on our wood Kitchen table, and now the table has hundreds if not thousands of scratches in the area she was playing. The first time she played, we put a plastic tray underneath the black tray that the sand comes in. The second time, somehow the lower tray Slipped away, and every time she moved the black tray, the little bits of escaped sand were scratching away at our table. To be clear, we never placed the sand directly on the table, it just is messy stuff and *gets everywhere,* and even the littlest bit will be abrasive to wood. I’m so sad about the damage done to the table.
customer_reviews.author: C&M H

customer_reviews.title: You can build sand castles in the living room!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her sand. The molds it comes with makes it easy to build sand castles. She loves the pink and blue sand, has no interest in using the tan colored sand. Can you blame her?? The only downside is that it’s quite messy. She’s careful about how she plays with it and even being as careful as she is, sand gets everywhere. It’s easy to clean up as it doesn’t necessarily stick to the floor or table. Just be ready to do some sweeping after play time.
customer_reviews.author: Family of 3

customer_reviews.title: a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a red sand and this did the trick. It has a different feel to it then the kinetic sand itself but still works the same just can't blend it with the kinetic sand. I was able to give one of the 2 lb bags to the teacher at my grandson's school for her class to help with sensory needs in the children. It has become a great hit in the class and at home. I bought a lot of sensory sand was able to make a lot of different colors I'll try it with this as well and see how it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Galaxy SIII

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like kinetic sand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a student with sensory processing problems. He loves the color green and likes things to be very ‘clean’. When I opened this it was extremely dry and stuck all over my hands. I add a little water per instructions- no help at all. There is no way that the intended student will be able to use, there’s also no way I’m letting anyone use this in my classroom. Simply wiping the table with disinfectant wipes requires multiple passes as it does not come up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean up - Sent back
customer_reviews.text: This was NOT easy to clean up and did not really stick to itself like other kinetic sand we have tried. WIthin a few minutes of play it was ALL OVER furniture, floor, everywhere my daughter touched and it was nearly impossible to clean up. I was really bummed. The regular "Kinetic Sand" brand sand, with the brown sand, was MUCH easier to clean up and manage. The whole point of this stuff is that it's fun and sticks to itself for easy clean up right?!
customer_reviews.author: UnicornMomNJ

customer_reviews.title: Be caution. It will color everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this product gets so many 5 stars. Compared with play sand I bought from last year, this product has so many flaws: It's a little pricy Difficult to form a shape Dye everywhere even my kids' hand Due to above reason (especially it colored my kids hand), it makes me questioning it's quality. Do not recommend. Reason I give it 2 star Instead of 1 is it at least a sand that you can play with.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great sensory fun for young kids and old kids, too
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for our 5 and 3 year old grandchildren. They knew about Kinetic sand ahead of time and were so excited. The container with cover that came with the set was handy for keeping it dry and clean or we would have had to makeshift a container to seal it up. They played for 90 minutes!! Yes, some landed on the floor, but we contained 98% of it. Will continue to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.  No frills.
customer_reviews.text: Kinetic sand is always a big hit in our house. This is just as wonderful as any we've bought. A couple things would have given it 5 stars: * I wish it had a lid. It came with a little tray, but a lid would have been nice to keep it in when I was done. * The molds were smaller than expected. I probably would have figured it out if i had read the description a little better, but oh well. Still acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Sooperswanc

customer_reviews.title: Fun but high maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun product. My toddler enjoyed it during our heat waves. Unfortunately for me clean up was exhausting. The sand gets adhered to everything. I gave my toddler a bath and she still had sand all over her skin needless to say the kitchen floor. It's didn't come with any airtight container which instead of the carbon box they could have packed it in a airtight container. We will see how long it last since a lot gets wasted while cleaning up.
customer_reviews.author: 14serenity

customer_reviews.title: Not your average kinetic sand.
customer_reviews.text: Alright..I typically don’t enjoy giving less than 5 stars but I can’t stay silent about this product. We initially chose this sand because it’s blue and because it came with 6lbs of sand at a great price .However this is not your typical kinetic sand .This sand leaves a grainy feel and blue residue which is an absolute nightmare for cleanup. My son loves sand though so it didn’t bother him. In the future we will just buy the kinetic sand brand that we’ve grown to know and love to avoid the hand tinting issue.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have moon sand, kinetic sand and now morphing matter. The morphing matter is by far my favorite. I bought the three color pack. It has a soft, fluffy, spongy texture that is hard to describe, but wonderful to play with. It doesn't stick to hands, easy to clean up, no chemical smell, no residue left behind. Bright, vibrant colors. I'm really delighted with it, and don't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blatay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing magic sand fun!
customer_reviews.text: I teach preschool and my kids LOVE this stuff. I kinda envisioned the bags being a lot bigger, I had to use all 3 to fill the sensory bin and when it’s all mixed together it’s all purple. Nevertheless my kids really wanted to play with this stuff every day until 2 weeks later I was like Alright - so many little hands and little ones sneezing it’s done Super fun and I wish I could afford to buy this all The time Class hit!
customer_reviews.author: Tibbie Skye West

customer_reviews.title: hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My two year old has a large tray full of this stuff on his table and spends more time than I can count pushing his little diggers around in it. I leave it out all the time, don't pack it back up or cover it or anything and it seems perfectly fine (we've had it out in the open for about 2 months now), or at least it serves our purpose very well. It does, however, turn your floor into slippery glass, if you don't have a carpet, so, careful with the little ones - and yourself - when they start to make a mess!
customer_reviews.author: Pcelica063

customer_reviews.title: Stains
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun to play with. It is very relaxing and I can see people using this as stress relief. I actually bought this for my baby to play with in his sand table. Unfortunately the blue dye comes off and stains everything including his skin. It is very messy and for that reason I’m giving it two stars. I definitely would look into another brand to get one that does not have any dye transfer.
customer_reviews.author: LittleRed

customer_reviews.title: Paid for 12lbs, got only 10lbs.
customer_reviews.text: I received 5 x 2lbs packages for a total of 10lbs. There should have been a sixth package (for 12 lbs). It came in a non-description box, so I don’t know if this was an omission or a purposeful scam, but I triple checked on two scales (not 5 x 2.4lbs (which would be an usual way to divide), but definitely 5 x 2lbs). Not worth repackaging and sending back for the difference, but definitely didn’t get what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The sand is awesome. The sand box that can with it is too small for all the sand and the mold are cheap plastic. I bought this one and one that's a different brand they are pretty much the same kit for the about the same price but it has a bigger sand box and the molds good quality plastic plus it came with a mini shovel. Not a bad product I just think it's overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: My toddler is in loving this!!
customer_reviews.text: Saw a similar product at a local learning store for triple this price. So I decided to check out amazon. I wasn’t disappointed!! My four year old loves his blue sand and plays with it regularly. It is sooo much that my teenagers like playing with it as well. I will definitely be keeping this on my list for future Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: MeliMama

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Both my son and my daughter loved the National Geographic sand. The first day they were distracted for hours! It didn’t come with anything to store it in but I purchased some inexpensive containers from Walmart. The sand is easy to clean up when they are done playing and I don’t think it is too messy to begin with. Definitely will buy more colors in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Fun color, fun to touch
customer_reviews.text: The sand is not as magnetic as I perceived. It can still be very messy. I have an almost 2 year old and he’s not quite ready for this but he likes the feel of it. He’ll make a mess easily of course. The container it comes in is to small to play in. We put everything in a baking pan. Young toddlers might want to throw it around lol. When it’s on the floor it’s not easy to pick up with other magnetic sand. The storage for the sand and toys is an open container, not a ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my son as a gift. Little did I know, it would soon become my "toy"... something about kinetic sand is so satisfying to touch and squeeze! I was concerned about it turning our hands or the surface different colors as displayed in some of the pictures but this did not seem to be an issue for us at all. In short, we love this product: fun, decently priced and arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H

customer_reviews.title: Careful what color you get.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the blue and the pink, the blue does exactly what it’s supposed to but is a little sandier than kinetic brand. The pink had glitter in it that got everywhere and was horrible, I’m returning it after less than 24 hours because it is garbage that my 3 year old can’t play with. I’m planning to order her another batch of the blue one since I know it has no glitter and am assuming that caused the problem with the pink one. Hopefully the second blue batch is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Useful or trash!

customer_reviews.title: Messy but my grandson has fun with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this in a pan lightly covered with plastic wrap for many months and it hasn't dried out. I did get a small hand broom and dust pan to clean it from the floor and pour it back in the pan. Otherwise it would disappear quickly when my four year old grandson plays with it on the hard floor in the kitchen. It isn't kind to carpet. Don't wet it to clean up or it leaves a blue patch. I lightly brush it with a paint brush to loosen the sand and vacuum the spot.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: so much fun.
customer_reviews.text: so much fun and love the color. seems stiff but read instructions put in a large bowl fluff and perfect. could add small amount of water like only teaspoon or less and fluff. do not add too much water or it will make colors bleed and loose consistency. i play with this for hours with my 4 year old daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppa V.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: My son has been really wanting kinetic sand so I finally said ok after many failed diy attempts. This is a nice little starter kit. 2 pounds of sand and some toys with multiple color choices. The box it comes with to play with the sand seemed way too small to actually play with so we got a larger Tupperware from the dollar store with a lid. Keeps my kid busy for a good while. It's fun and relaxing to squish it between your fingers and let it melt off your hands. Just like regular sand it does still get everywhere and needs to be vacuumed up, so be prepared for a little loss.
customer_reviews.author: TwoPupsAndABoy

customer_reviews.title: Fun for ANY age!
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a small amount of sand but this stuff is fun! I put it in my son's sand and water table and we (yes WE) squished and patted and made pyramids and destroyed with the glee of a two-year-old and 31-year-old. If it gets a little wet, mix all the sand together and it works itself out. I could see this staining (they give you information and precautions in the box regarding the sand) so be aware.
customer_reviews.author: JoOzSim

customer_reviews.title: This sand is incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several different sands for the kids. I ordered this as a birthday present and I am in aww of it. It is the coolest thing. It really moves on its own as you shift it with your hand. It does not dry out! The kids and adults love playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the package and I immediately noticed how much softer this sand is compared to Kinetic Sand. It feels fluffy and super lightweight. The biggest con at this point is that it's drier and therefore doesn't clean up as well. It sticks to your hands but comes off easily. The price point is a definite pro. I haven't had to deal with anything other reviewers complained about.... yet. I've only owned it for all of 10 minutes. This is more of a first impression review.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: They loved it. It was a little messy but worked ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my grandchildren kinetic sand for my house. They loved it. It was a little messy but worked well and stayed moist. Then I bought this sand from National Geographic. It looks nice but when I opened the package of sand what a gigantic mess. First it was dry. I added water like they advised. Then I thought how the bacteria will multiply, the sand dried out quickly, was a mess to clean up and the color stained our hands and molds. I am sorry I bought this product. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Color dyes your skin!  Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: This turned my daughter's hands blue. It's like they just added terrible blue food coloring to the sand. Not at all as good as the name brand kinetic sand that's out there. I wish I could return this - but we wound up throwing it away as soon as it started dying everyone and everything in our house blue. PLEASE AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Breakfast

customer_reviews.title: Not like Kinetic Sand
customer_reviews.text: Ok so if you have ever had Kinetic Sand this is NOT the same. The sand will not stay together at all to mold or play with. It also comes off too easy and makes a mess. For as much as it cost I wiah we would have went with the actual Kinetic Sand brand. Is it still better then some other brands...maybe so but we are sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Was worried because of the negative reviews but my need for bulk quality kinetic sand made me go for it. My 3 year old and I have been creating a city all evening. We made tire marks with his monster trucks and then squished it all. The sand doesn’t feel moist at all, but it still sticks to itself. It falls apart when held as kinetic sand should.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I find it interesting that the review asks about airtight storage when the sand came in cellophane bags that were not resealable? This colored sand is not as good as the regular kinetic sand IMO. It seems to dry out quicker in ziploc bags. I use this with my students in my classroom as a quiet transition activity in order to help them reset and refocus after lunch before beginning academics. From now on, I will not repurchase the colored sand.
customer_reviews.author: L Davie

customer_reviews.title: Won't let my kids play because of the mess
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would of read more reviews first 🙄. It's very dry, doesn't stick together at all. Makes a huge mess!!! I never let my kids play with it because of the mess. There friends have a different brand and it's awesome. They mine as well be playing with regular sand.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Corney

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice to select option not to have all the plastic molds as I already have several and larger amounts of sand. Otherwise we love it!!!! I have it in my outside sensory table but my kiddos absolutely love it I have the blue, purple and pink. It's so much fun especially during these times of staying at home
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Best play sand
customer_reviews.text: This sand is soft and doesn’t dry out like other kinetic sand. I’ve purchased other brands - but this is my favorite. I used this sand to make a construction site sensory bin for my son and he enjoys building sand castles and tearing them down with his little construction vehicles. It’s a lot of fun for him! When you remove sand from packaging, it is stiff - but after you break it apart, it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: dinosaursprinkles

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughters loved this
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter specifically requested this for her 5th birthday and loves it so much and so did her 3-year old sister. The colors of the sand are vibrant and the sand never dries out. The sand is damp and heartier than beach sand because after you press and lift off of a mold, if you touch the sand, it doesn't all fall apart unless you press harder. You will want to use a tray like the size of a cookie sheet with a lip maybe on top of a plastic tablecloth for easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment with an easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a surprise for my 5year old to help him pass the time during shelter in place. He absolutely loves it! Product was delivered a day earlier than originally predicted, and is exactly as described. 3 huge bags of colored kinetic sand. Even came with some small pyramids for shaping the sand. Only downside is that you have to figure out how to store it in an air tight container when they’re done playing with it, but that’s not a huge deal. Ziplocks do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremi495

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Not too Messy
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this stuff. It doesn't dry out and we put it in a separate container and haven't had to close it since we got it. It's messy, but not like regular sand that gets into everything. It's worth it for kinectic play at a good price. Would provide be really good for a child with sensory issues. It's soothing.
customer_reviews.author: Morgaine

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for happy child.
customer_reviews.text: I like that with each pound it comes individually wrapped. So it lasts a little while longer. Easy to work with. As other reviews have stated a bit of the dye comes off and can be tricky to wash off little hands. I found it helpful to buy a long flat plastic storage container from the dollar store to store the sand in. I also use an old plastic table cloth underneath to catch what comes out of the container. I personally like the sand because it keeps my asd child busy for a long time. It's good to have for bad weather days or just as a calming tool for an upset child.
customer_reviews.author: kareena

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandchildren, and according to my daughter-in-law, they loved it. She says they play with it for hours on end. I already had some of the first kinetic sand at my house, but she said she likes this is even better.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the natural color and was very happy. I thought the colored "sand" would be for fun my Grandchildren. First the "sand" faded and it is now just turned into sand. It no longer sticks together. I thought 'National geographic ' would be a quality product? Sadly I was very very wrong!
customer_reviews.author: 123GO

customer_reviews.title: Big hit! Very clean.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! My kids love. Comes in 6 bags, very convenient of you do not want to open them all at once. The bags are not resealable but that wasnt an issue for us, we keep resealable bags at home all the time. It all fit back into 1 gallon size bag. We had a birthday that day and kids off all ages as well as adult were mesmerized! I have not seen any staining and anything that happens to fall off his mat vacuums right up.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to clean up
customer_reviews.text: My 8yo just got this for her birthday. We used to sterno trays to keep the sand contained when playing with it. Some sand did spill out, but it was super easy to clean up. The sand sticks together so clean up was easy. I can’t speak to whether it dries out because we just got it. The color does not rub off on hands at all. It was a big hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Tam

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sand
customer_reviews.text: We have bought a few brands of kinetic sand and loved them. They felt like sand, stuck together great. Very little mess. I wanted to buy this bc it was green. But its horrible. It barely sticks together, clings to clothing, is horrible to clean up and it doesn't keep it shape from the molds. I'll be throwing it away and buying actual kinetic sand.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: Imagination wonderland Sand!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this sand for my five year old as they have some at school. This sand is amazing for her to play with and use her imagination to create. The sand itself has a very unique feel to it, and it lives up to the promise of not drying out and not working. Many imaginative things can be made with this, I am excited to order more colors for her to create.
customer_reviews.author: C Jacks

customer_reviews.title: If it's cold and you're missing the beach, check this sand out, guys!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was great! WE love kinetic sand and this is the first time we have gotten a colored sand. It didn't stain and 2 weeks later it's still as in good as shape as when we got it. We keep it in plastic ware to keep it clean and usable. Definitely not a toy for the kids room. Little bits can fall off but are easily retrieved, although hair and other junk will stick to it. I like the little molds that came with it, super fancy and a bonus. Overall, we are quite happy with the quality and value, as well as hours of fun this has given us already.
customer_reviews.author: Chylife

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold together as well as other brands
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love kinetic sand. The last bag we bought had finally gotten too dirty, so I replaced it with this. Unfortunately it doesn’t hold together as well as the last batch. I don’t know what brand we had before, but I am on a quest to find it. This sand is still fun—my kids love it—but it stains their hands and is a bear to clean up. When the sand sticks together a little better, it’s easier to pick up the bits that fall on the floor or the table. This stuff just has to get swept away.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing should have read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is not kenitic sand it's powdery and messy and doesn't stick to itself they way kenitic sand does i bought this thinking I'd get more for my money but I was very disappointed I ended up with both types of sand in green one for each of my boys the kenitic sand was exactly what I've always bought a blessing for parents this sand is a headache and made the biggest mess that was only cleanable with a vaccume
customer_reviews.author: Elle_E

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stick together
customer_reviews.text: Our kids all love kinetic sand, but we were very disappointed with this one. It came predictably dry, like a lot of the other reviews said, so we tried moistening it, which helped it a bit. But at the end of the day it was still super fine and powdery, and didn't stick together like other brands we've used.
customer_reviews.author: Clara B

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent gift for kids from 4 - 14
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent gift for kids from 4 - 14. The sand molds very well because it sticks together. Clean up is a cinch. The utensils that come with it make for creative play in making things. The container that comes with it serves as a base for everything or you can play with the sand on a flat surface. All our 5 grandchildren love it.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN A ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My five year old daughter loves playing with this. It doesn’t come with a storage container but I just keep everything inside of the black container it comes with, and put it inside a gallon sized ziploc bag. Works just fine. It still gets everywhere but it’s easy to vacuum right up.
customer_reviews.author: Faithnlove

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, amazing quality, amazing customer service. We ordered this sand in purple. The seller followed up checking in before the product arrived. After arrival it was a little stiff still. No questions asked, seller had a replacement sent to us in just a few days. I’m not sure why there are reviews saying the color bleeds and stains. My kids get this everywhere. It has never stained the carpet, hands, clothes, or anything for that matter. My girls LOVEEE it. Almost 6 months after opening it still feels fresh like the day we opened it. Will be buying more in the future in other colors. Absolutely wonderful product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis LaCross

customer_reviews.title: Very fun but doesnt say non toxic anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product. we all had fun with it until the wife pointed out that it didn't say nontoxic. We always supervise or play with the sand and our kids so we can keep an eye if they eat it but it would be nice if they posted that on the box. cool distraction and time burner.
customer_reviews.author: Nesto

customer_reviews.title: Different, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and my son loves it. My only complaint is that it has a different texture when compared to the kinetic sand brand. This one has more of a sand like feel to it. Which isn’t bad, but it is different and I wouldn’t mix it in with the other brand. In my opinion it doesn’t hold up as great as the kinetic sand brand too, but it still does the job. Because we already have the kinetic sand brand, I wouldn’t purchase this again. I don’t mind the product though and would still use it if it’s separated from the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for my bucks.
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for how much you get. I got 12 lbs and split it between 2 kids. Bought cheap plastic bins from a store to contain it. They love this stuff and have played with it several times a week for a whole year, so it was time for a replacement batch. One if the few toys that actually get a lot of use instead of sitting in a toybox forgotten, and if you get stuff to play with it then it's creative for them.
customer_reviews.author: J. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages over 3
customer_reviews.text: I brought this kinetic sand to a family reunion. It is great for kids who can keep their play contained. It’s expensive if you have toddlers throwing it around. I dumped it onto a couple of plastic boot trays, but it would have been wise to put the trays on a tarp to catch the inevitable spillage. It arrives very compacted, but it fluffed up quickly with play. The little molds were a nice bonus. Wish it came with more molds, given the amount of sand.
customer_reviews.author: Linda O

customer_reviews.title: Creative fun!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves playing with this. He puts his dinosaurs and cars in it too. I put it in a large plastic bin so that it doesn't get all over the place, but some still escapes. What can you expect with a 3 year old? I added cookie cutters for additional shapes. WE use it on a wooden floor so the "escaped" sand is easy to brush up & return to the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Fun, Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for our grandkids ages 2-6 to play with at our house. They love it & I enjoy playing with them. The texture is soft and malleable & the color is vibrant. The price is reasonable for the amount of sand we received. The box actually contains six sealed bags of sand. Cleanup is simple. On hard floors the sand can be swept up and reused. It vacuums easily out of carpet. We are very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: DJSpokane

customer_reviews.title: It’s a lot of sand!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my daughter for Christmas after they had purchased some small packages of kinetic sand from Walmart. This stuff is just as good and ya get a heck of a lot of it. We purchased one of the closesbke shoe bins from Walmart, the 18x30ish ones and it’s at least two inches thick throughout it. (Keeps it better contained as well) great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Baldman

customer_reviews.title: Feels like real sand, totally worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little cautious when buying this because of people stating that their hands were blue after playing, but my son has had this for 7 months and nothing has been dyed blue. PLEASE DONT ADD WATER! it's not like the orignal kinetic sand, this is thicker and has more of a consistency of sand. It doesnt dry out and the clean up has always been easy. I believe when it gets wet is when the dye comes off which would make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: An essential quarantine must have
customer_reviews.text: Okay so this is a really cool set. You take it right out of the box and you’re ready to go. You definitely need a tray to keep the sand in but my overactive two and a half year old had already been sitting and playing for an hour so this is amazing. Great for creative play but can get messy. Absolutely recommend for any parents sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Anne K

customer_reviews.title: Great Sand! Kids LOVE it. TIPS for no mess
customer_reviews.text: My kids ages 5 and 2 love this sand! I put a large blanket down then give each kid a cookie sheet for their sand. They like to build little castles with the molds it comes with. I also give them little plastic animals for them to play in it as well. The sand is very soft and not nearly as messy as I feared it could be. Especially using a cookie sheet underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Hollan

customer_reviews.title: Blue product stained our hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from my kids after having bought kinetic sand. Thought I’d try it since it was a few bucks cheaper. But I there’s definitely a reason for that. I found it behaved like kinetic sand when compressed, but was much finer and “drier” (crumbly) and more difficult to pick up. It also mildly stained my daughter’s hands blue (but not my sons’). Will go back to kinetic sand brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chiona

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: It stinks! Even after adding essential oils.. the chemical smell is terrible. And it does leave staining marks. Sand itself is ok if u can get past the other factors. We use f0r sensory therapy tho, for our asd teen on spectrum. So this isn't used hardly due to those reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Rocha

customer_reviews.title: I love this sand as much as my preschoolers do!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sensory product. I as a preschool teacher. This is a BIG hit with children. This comes with 3 airtight bags and a bag with 6 mini molds. I emptied each bag into a plasic shoe box -type container that comes with a lid. This is enough for three difffernt children in the class to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Solution for winters sandbox withdraw
customer_reviews.text: Our sand arrived and was in the mailbox on a frigid day. Once warmed to room temperature it molded nicely, but didn't quite flow /appear as expected. An email follow up to make sure it had arrived and asking for response if any issues, led to being advised to try adding just a few drops of water. This stuff is awesome! The youngest at almost 3 plays with it in the table and when finished it all patted back together to store. The adults were drawn to sifting it thru fingers and watching it move. Fun stuff!! Recommend both the National Geographic ultimate sand and buying from them was a pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. Haines

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so cool! I’m playing right along with my two year old and we’re having a blast. I love that it doesn’t stick to your hands or make a mess, and it’s super soft. I taped a long piece of parchment paper to his tray for easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis H.

customer_reviews.title: Dry, not moldable
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a kinetic-type moldable sand, this is not it. The sand is like beach sand, coarse and dry. I tried the remedy listed in the included instructions and added water to the sand with no success. Even a couple drops of water only proceeded to turn my fingers blue and still leave the sand feeling dry.
customer_reviews.author: Deidra

customer_reviews.title: Just not that great
customer_reviews.text: First, the sand is not the purple shown. The bin that you store it in has no lid and is cheap. The sand does not have the texture that previously purchased sand has. Just not great. Would not buy. Just get sand and find a cool storage thing as a gift for someone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandkids as a Christmas stocking stuff. My grandson attends a STEM School already and my granddaughter is going to begin Kindergarten in the Fall and both of my grandkids are so smart. They love playing with this sand and spend hours with it. It is a great product that will help your kids spark their imagination and engineering ideas as they construct whatever their minds come up with.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: The National Geographic customer service people were super friendly and interested in my satisfaction of this product
customer_reviews.text: The National Geographic customer service people were super friendly and interested in my satisfaction of this product. I think it is what it says it is, it's just not like the other kinetic sand I bought my boys. This sand is much drier and isn't as fluid. Maybe if I had added water or something it would have fluffed it up. At any rate, National Geographic was very good to work with.
customer_reviews.author: T. Catmull

customer_reviews.title: Messy fun, don’t give as a gift unless you want parents to be mad later :)
customer_reviews.text: Very messy. Stains little hands that play with it for more than 10 minutes. Very messy and hard to clean up. It’s sand that feels like it has water in it so it sticks together and molds into shapes. But do not be fooled it is an outdoor activity. My husband just made us throw it away bc it made such a mess on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Eichler

product_meta.title: NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC Play Sand - 2 LBS of Sand with Castle Molds and Tray (Blue) - A Kinetic Sensory Activity
feature_bullets: SENSORY SAND – This sand is kinetic, so it sticks only to itself and not to you! This perpetually “wet” sand is perfect to mold, shape, and squeeze
6 EXCITING MOLDS – Kids can build castles, pyramids, and more with the 6 different molds included
2 POUND SAND SET WITH TRAY– A special mixture of sand that doesn’t dry out, allowing you to use it again and again
NON-TOXIC & MESS-FREE –This hypoallergenic sand is non-toxic and super easy to clean up!
RESPECTED QUALITY – Providing children with the best educational toys, this kit is backed by National Geographic’s 100% satisfaction guarantee

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,316 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
